desc: Earth is the only planet known to harbor life, with a unique combination of land, water, and atmosphere. Its diversity of environments, from forests to deserts to oceans, has supported a vast array of life forms for billions of years.

struc.name: Crust
struc.value: The outermost solid layer where all life exists.

struc.name: Mantle
struc.value: The thick layer beneath the crust, consisting of slowly moving semi-solid rock.

struc.name: Outer core
struc.value: A liquid layer made of iron and nickel, responsible for generating Earth's magnetic field.

struc.name: Inner core
struc.value: The solid innermost layer, composed of iron and nickel, under immense pressure.
